Series.Overview: Four egocentric friends who run a neighborhood Irish pub in Philadelphia try to find their way through the adult world of work and relationships. Unfortunately, their warped views and precarious judgments often lead them to trouble, creating a myriad of uncomfortable situations that usually only get worse before they get better.

Episode.GuestStars: |Montre Burton|George Weiss Vando|Jon Cellini|Sydney 'Big Dawg' Colston|Jesse C. Boyd|Aaron Hartzler|Ungenita Prevost|Sheldon Candis|Ian MacKinnon|Telisha Shaw|Malcolm Barrett|Mary Elizabeth Ellis|
Episode.Overview: The guys hire Dee's friend, Terrell to promote the bar. Meanwhile, Charlie tries to prove that he is not a racist.

Episode.GuestStars: |Mary Elizabeth Ellis|Spencer Daniels|Autumn Reeser|Heather Donahue|Amy Higgins|Esther Ellsworth|Sonia Jackson|Benton Jennings|Cormac Bluestone|Holly Reeser|
Episode.Overview: A girl from Charlie's past reveals they have a child together. Mac sees the benefits in being a pro-life advocate, while Dennis uses an abortion rally to meet women.

Episode.GuestStars: |Kelsie Lynn|Robert Adamson|Katie Chonacas|Jaimie Alexander|Ryan Alvarez|Trish Coren|Brian McLaughlin|Greg Alba|
Episode.Overview: After reminiscing about high school, the guys conclude that it would be a public service if they allowed teens to drink in the bar, thus providing a safe and controlled environment for teens to party. Feeling that she missed out on a lot as a teenager due to having to wear a brace for her scoliosis, Dee begins dating a high school jock.

Episode.GuestStars: |Artemis Pebdani|Brittany Daniel|Mary Elizabeth Ellis|Dennis Hogan|Dennis Hart|
Episode.Overview: After discovering that he might have cancer, Mac and Dennis attempt to find a woman who will sleep with Charlie. In the midst of their search, Mac falls in love with a transsexual he meets at the bar named Carmen. Overwhelmed by the extra workload that she had to take on since Charlie has taken a leave of absence, Dee tries to get Dennis to hire a recently out of work actress friend to help out.

Episode.GuestStars: |Michael Rosenbaum|Shelly Desai|Robert Blanche|
Episode.Overview: The guys buy a gun after the bar's safe is stolen.

Episode.EpisodeName: The Gang Finds a Dead Guy
Episode.GuestStars: |Tom Bower|Lindsey McKeon|Patrick Gorman|Ted Rooney|
Episode.Overview: Mac and Dennis befriend a patron found dead at their bar in order to win the affection of his granddaughter.

Episode.GuestStars: |Dennis Haskins|Lynne Marie Stewart|Nate Mooney|Jimmi Simpson|Andrew Friedman|Chris Hendrie|Don Scribner|
Episode.Overview: Charlie and Mac's old high school gym teacher is accused of molestation.

Episode.GuestStars: |Kristoffer Polaha|Natasha Leggero|Sara Erikson|Tiffany Haddish|Josh Fadem|
Episode.Overview: An accident that puts Charlie in a wheelchair opens up a window of possibilities for the gang. Meanwhile, Dennis and Dee’s estranged father reenters their life in hopes of starting anew with his children and soon discovers that he enjoys the lifestyle of their friends.

Episode.GuestStars: |Anne Archer|Josh Stamberg|Ravi Patel|Rick Zahn|
Episode.Overview: When the gang learns that they are in danger of losing their bar due to a zoning mishap, they resort to some outlandish and extreme methods to prevent that from happening. Meanwhile, Frank isn’t too happy when his wife returns to town.

Episode.EpisodeName: Dennis and Dee Go on Welfare
Episode.GuestStars: |Joanna Sanchez|Eddie Pepitone|Aisha Hinds|Keith Bullard|Zoe Bournelis|Rachael Platt|
Episode.Overview: After quitting their job due to Frank's continuing interference, Dennis and Dee decide to seek alternative income by going on welfare. Meanwhile, Mac and Charlie must now bear the consequences of their friends’ departures from the business.

Episode.GuestStars: |Anne Archer|Mary Elizabeth Ellis|Lucy DeVito|Lynne Marie Stewart|Marcia Ann Burrs|Sandy Martin|
Episode.Overview: Barbara hooks up with Mac to make Frank jealous, which leads to retaliation from Dennis.

Episode.GuestStars: |Eddie Mekka|Jessie Ward|Jason Van Over|Katie Kreisler|Luis Daniel Ponce|Sean Twomey|Cynthia Harmon|
Episode.Overview: Frank runs into an old adversary at the gym when he begins teaching Dee to box after she was robbed. Hoping to make some extra money on the side, Mac and Dennis make preparations for Charlie to compete in an underground street fighting match.

Episode.GuestStars: |Mary Elizabeth Ellis|Patrick Hallahan|Bill H. McKenzie|Carlon Jeffery|Calvin Tran|Andy Pessoa|Tumbleweed|Harold Chin|
Episode.Overview: After being arrested for arson the gang is sentenced to do community service. Frank makes an effort to connect more with Dennis. Meanwhile, Charlie is also ordered to attend AA where he makes a startling discovery that might be beneficial in his ongoing quest to hook up with the Waitress.

Episode.GuestStars: |David Hornsby|Gina Morelli|Jack Axelrod|Philip Perlman|
Episode.Overview: Mac and Dee become uncomfortable when the rest of the guys decide to make some extra money by exploiting the similarities between a water stain and the Virgin Mary. A reunion with someone from the past, stirs up forbidden feelings within Dee.

Episode.GuestStars: |John Rosenfeld|Donna Hardy|Damian Young|Gregory R. Goliath|Patrick Thomas O'Brien|Kelley Birney|Brian Fitzpatrick|Edward James Gage|Catherine Schreiber|
Episode.Overview: Driven by Frank's insight into the world of politics, Dennis pursues a political career by running for office.

Episode.EpisodeName: Charlie Goes America All Over Everybody's Ass
Episode.GuestStars: |Jimmi Simpson|Nate Mooney|Carla Alapont|Sabrina Machado|Artemis Pebdani|Dennis Staroselsky|Morgan Walsh|Lucas Papaelias|
Episode.Overview: Dennis and Mac make a decision to take away all rules concerning moral and behavioral etiquette at Paddy's after an argument about the Constitution. Frank uses the decision and it's following consequences to his own gain. Meanwhile, Charlie tries to convey his love for America by protesting while Dee attempts to reaffirm her goal of being an actress.

Episode.EpisodeName: Dennis and Dee Get a New Dad
Episode.GuestStars: |Anne Archer|Stephen Collins|Lynne Marie Stewart|Gregory Scott Cummins|Matthew J. Evans|Lucy DeVito|
Episode.Overview: Dee receives e-mails from a stranger claiming to be her and Dennis' real father. Meanwhile, Mac decides to visit his father who is in prison.

Episode.EpisodeName: The Gang Finds a Dumpster Baby
Episode.GuestStars: |Lynne Marie Stewart|Todd Grinnell|Jackie Tohn|Lucy DeVito|Danny Hill|Isaac Gabaeff|Kate Mulligan|
Episode.Overview: The gang finds a baby in a dumpster, and Dee and Mac decide to raise him. Meanwhile, Dennis wants to join a group of environmental activists and Charlie attempts to learn the truth about his paternity.

Episode.GuestStars: |Faizon Love|Jimmi Simpson|Nate Mooney|Bob Rusch|Artemis Pebdani|Geoffrey Owens|Steven Lee Allen|Philip Newby|Thesy Surface|
Episode.Overview: Mac, Dennis and Dee try out for the Philadelphia Eagles. Also interested in becoming an Eagle is Liam and Ryan McPoyle's brother, Doyle.

Episode.EpisodeName: Dennis and Dee's Mom is Dead
Episode.GuestStars: |Stephen Collins|Brian Unger|Jose Yenque|Sam Witwer|Marcus Toji|Edward Kiniry-Ostro|Cy Carter|
Episode.Overview: After Barbara's death, Dee and Frank are unhappy to learn that she left them both out of the will, while Dennis inherits the mansion which he plans to turn into a party pad.

Episode.GuestStars: |Jimmi Simpson|Nate Mooney|Thesy Surface|
Episode.Overview: The McPoyles hold the entire gang hostage at Paddys while Frank is busy searching for his will in the air ducts.

Episode.EpisodeName: The Aluminum Monster vs. Fatty Magoo
Episode.GuestStars: |Judy Greer|Rachelle Wood|Michael Marc Friedman|
Episode.Overview: Dee is shocked to learn that an overweight social outcast from her High School has become a rich and skinny fashion designer.

Episode.EpisodeName: The Gang Solves the North Korea Situation
Episode.GuestStars: |Tania Gunadi|Maxie J. Santillan Jr.|Takayo Fischer|Donna Pieroni|
Episode.Overview: A Korean restaurant owner threatens to get Paddy's kicked off the route for the city's annual pub crawl. The gang's response: War.

Episode.GuestStars: |Mary Elizabeth Ellis|Charles Gideon Davis|John Lathan|Terence Bernie Hines|Phil De Barros|
Episode.Overview: The gang agrees to sell Paddys when they get an offer that is too good to refuse, but it forces the bar's non-partners, Dee and Charlie to find new jobs.

Episode.EpisodeName: Frank Sets Sweet Dee On Fire
Episode.GuestStars: |Brittany Krall|Bill Seward|Lillian Adams|Pedro Lopez|Alex Sol|
Episode.Overview: Mac teams up with Frank and Charlie to create a public access newscast after he misses his chance at fame in the news. Meanwhile, Dennis and Dee try to make it big in the club scene.

Episode.EpisodeName: Sweet Dee's Dating a Retarded Person
Episode.GuestStars: |Kyle Davis|Nick Toren|
Episode.Overview: Dee gets involved with a famous local rapper who might be mentally challenged, and whose success inspires the rest of the gang to start a band.

Episode.GuestStars: |Mary Elizabeth Ellis|Brittany Daniel|Sandy Martin|Marcuis Harris|Bill Chott|
Episode.Overview: After Mac arrives to the bar with scratches on his neck and exhibiting strange behavior, Frank comes to the conclusion that he is the serial killer terrorizing young women in Philadelphia. Frank sets out with his trusty chainsaw and a doubtful Charlie to find evidence to implicate Mac in the murders. In search of another suspect, Dennis and Dee do a little role-playing in order to help themselves better understand who they might be dealing with.

Episode.EpisodeName: Dennis Looks Like a Registered Sex Offender
Episode.GuestStars: |Gary Kraus|Bryan Birge|Gregory Scott Cummins|Mary Ann Hermansen|Sandy Martin|Connor McCoy|Katie McElhenney|Dan Meloche|Kathy Romano|Lynne Marie Stewart|
Episode.Overview: When Dennis is mistaken for a recently released child molester, he is more bothered by the fact that the guy is overweight rather than him being a sex offender. Meanwhile, Mac tries once again to bond with his ex-con father, who shows an interest in Dee.

Episode.GuestStars: |James Price|Matt Cedeño|Mario Di Donato|Big Will Harris|John Mariano|Robert Towers|Gregg Weiner|
Episode.Overview: After stumbling upon a kilo of cocaine, the gang is forced to pay off a $25,000 debt to the mob. Mac becomes a mob informant, while Frank pimps out Dennis as an escort at the local country club. Charlie stumbles upon an opportunity to sell illegal narcotics.

Episode.GuestStars: |Joe Cortese|Mario Di Donato|David Hornsby|Karen James|John Mariano|Anthony Napoli|John Ponzio|James Price|
Episode.Overview: While paying off their debt to the mob, Charlie and Dee try to find a way to make fake cocaine in order to fool them, while Dennis ranks in thousands of dollars being pimped out at the local country club. Mac realizes his position as a mob informant isn't being utilized to its full potential.

Episode.EpisodeName: Bums: Making a Mess All Over the City
Episode.GuestStars: |Tracey Walter|Lee Weaver|Michael Merton|Ryan Homchick|Robert Michael Kelly|Carla Renata|Russ Widdall|
Episode.Overview: Mac and Dee become vigilantes in order to remove the homeless from their neighborhood, while Frank and Dennis impersonate police officers.

Episode.EpisodeName: The Gang Dances Their Asses Off
Episode.GuestStars: |Mary Elizabeth Ellis|David Hornsby|Randy Sklar|Jason Sklar|Aja Evans|Joe Cortese|
Episode.Overview: In the season finale, Charlie accidentally puts Paddy's up as a prize for a dance marathon, which prompts the gang to enter the competition in order to save their bar.

Episode.GuestStars: |David Hornsby|Kaidy Kuna|Jonathan Spencer|
Episode.Overview: Charlie and Dee have been stealing Frank's delicious meats, so Frank leaves out human meat to get back at them. Driven by their cannibalistic needs, Charlie and Dee go in search of human flesh. Mac and Dennis harass Frank for hunting defenseless animals and think it would be much more badass to hunt something that could fight back ... like a human.

Episode.EpisodeName: The Gang Solves the Gas Crisis
Episode.GuestStars: |Jay Harik|Melora Harte|Zachary Knighton|
Episode.Overview: Charlie, Mac, and Dennis formulate a plan to take advantage of the rising gas prices. By purchasing excess amounts now, they can sell it in the future and profit. As usual, things don't go as planned. Dee is also out to make money when she learns that Bruce is going to give the family fortune to a Muslim cultural center. She and Frank try to stop him and get the cash for themselves.

Episode.EpisodeName: America's Next Top Paddy's Billboard Model Contest
Episode.GuestStars: |Jennifer Birmingham|Edy Ganem|Frank Harts|T.J. Hoban|Carter MacIntyre|Marlene Mc'Cohen|Liana Mendoza|Steve Morrison|Suzanne Quast|Nancy Stelle|
Episode.Overview: Due to the gang's latest "business expenses," Paddy's is in dire need of money. Frank buys a billboard to advertise the bar, but Dee decides to create a viral video to post on YouTube for promotion. Charlie quickly joins her, leaving Frank and Mac to hold a contest for some hot models to feature on the billboard. Naturally, Dennis joins the competition to prove his worth.

Episode.GuestStars: Mary Elizabeth Ellis
Episode.Overview: Charlie finds out that the waitress has been seeing someone. He calls on Mac, his so-called best friend, to find out more information about the guy and to beat him up. However, it turns out that Mac is the guy the waitress has supposedly been seeing. Dennis, heartbroken that he's not Charlie's best friend, tries to win him over.

Episode.GuestStars: |Gregory Scott Cummins|Geoff Pierson|Bill M. Puluti|
Episode.Overview: Part 1 of 2. Mac and Charlie fake their deaths to avoid the wrath of Mac's father who was released from prison and is out for vengeance.

Episode.GuestStars: |Gregory Scott Cummins|Sandy Martin|Georgia McGreggor|Keir O'Donnell|Roberto 'Sanz' Sanchez|Lynne Marie Stewart|Atticus Todd|Nicole Marie White|
Episode.Overview: Part 2 of 2. Dennis, Frank, and Dee find unique ways of coping with the apparent loss of their friends.

Episode.GuestStars: |Jason Duplissea|Mary Elizabeth Ellis|David Hornsby|Douglad Park|Artemis Pebdani|Laurie Searle|
Episode.Overview: Charlie and Frank awake to find poop in their bed. Neither will confess to being the owner, so they, Mac, and Dennis try to scientifically deduce who dropped the deuce. Dee wants to do something a bit more sophisticated, so she invites the waitress and Artemis to a girls' night out.

Episode.EpisodeName: Paddy's Pub: The Worst Bar in Philadelphia
Episode.GuestStars: |Fisher Stevens|Rizwan Manji|David Zdunich|
Episode.Overview: A newspaper critic is kidnapped by the gang after he calls Paddy's pub the worst bar in Philadelphia.

Episode.GuestStars: |Rob Thomas|Sinbad|Lisa LoCicero|Lawrence Mandley|Cantrell Harris|Robert Khakh|Jesse Caron|Roberto Raad|Patrick Walsh|
Episode.Overview: After discovering Dennis' erotic memoir, Mac and Frank attempt to make some money off of it. Meanwhile, Dee and Charlie decide to spend a day in each other's shoes.

Episode.EpisodeName: Sweet Dee Has a Heart Attack
Episode.GuestStars: |Judi Barton|Michael Naughton|Kathleen Mary Carthy|Danso Gordon|Roy Jackson|Tim Sampson|Tom Vicini|
Episode.Overview: After Dee suffers a heart attack, she and Dennis try to live a healthier lifestyle. Meanwhile, Charlie and Mac take corporate jobs to get health insurance.

Episode.EpisodeName: The Gang Cracks the Liberty Bell
Episode.GuestStars: |David Hornsby|Pat Crawford Brown|Marcos Akiaten|Steven Flores|David Gueriera|Dennis W. Hall|Mike Cochrane|
Episode.Overview: The gang fudge history by claiming that Paddy's Pub was responsible for cracking the Liberty Bell in an attempt to turn their dive into a Philadelphia landmark.

Episode.EpisodeName: The Gang Gets Extreme: Home Makeover Edition
Episode.GuestStars: |Gabriela Moreno|Alejandro Patino|Laura Patricia Vega|Retta|
Episode.Overview: Hoping to make their own dreams come true, the gang sets out to give an unexpected family an extreme home makeover.

Episode.GuestStars: |Mary Elizabeth Ellis|Artemis Pebdani|Mae LaBorde|
Episode.Overview: In the season finale, Charlie gets the gang to help him put together a rock opera based on his song "Nightman."

Episode.EpisodeName: The Gang Exploits the Mortgage Crisis
Episode.Overview: Dennis, Mac, and Frank go into real estate, while Dee sets out to be a surrogate for a wealthy couple. Charlie gets into it with an attorney over the law.
The gang tries to expand their horizons by going on a road trip to the Grand Canyon.
With a shantytown taking shape outside, Mac and Dennis try to keep Paddy's going in tough times. Meanwhile, Frank and Dee start a family business.

Episode.EpisodeName: The Gang Gives Frank an Intervention
Episode.Overview: Frank's behavior is more bizarre than usual---so bizarre that even the gang notice---so they decide to stage an intervention.
The waitress is getting married, Dee is jealous that she's beating her to the altar, so she tries to derail the wedding.
The gang describes the trials and tribulations they went through, during game five of the World Series, in hopes the judge will clear them of all the citations they received.

Episode.EpisodeName: The Gang Wrestles for the Troops
Episode.Overview: The gang puts together a wrestling show for returning troops. Meanwhile, Dee finally meets the soldier that she has been communicating with over the internet.

Episode.EpisodeName: Paddy's Pub: Home of the Original Kitten Mittens
Episode.Overview: The gang decides to expand their business by developing a number of products that they could sell at Paddy's pub.
Mac and Dennis decide that they need to spend some time away from each other. Meanwhile, Charlie helps Dee search for her cat.
Dennis reveals his foolproof system for seducing any woman to the rest of the gang, but they don't grasp the concept.

Episode.EpisodeName: Mac and Charlie Write a Movie
Episode.Overview: When Dee gets a part in the new M. Night Shyamalan film, Mac and Charlie seize a chance to pitch their movie script.

After being banned for 10 years from a local drinking competition appropriately named "Flipadelphia," the gang tries to reignite their old rivalry with another local bar. Finding that they are in need of some serious practice, the guys head to Dennis' old fraternity house at the University of Pennsylvania to get their game up to speed while Dee hones her skills on her own. Frank wears skinny pants.

Episode.GuestStars: |Brittany Daniel|Lance Barber|
Episode.Overview: Mac defends traditional marriage, while the rest of the gang reaps the rewards of wedded bliss.
Marital bliss turns into business, as the gang experiences the emotional and economic hardships of divorce.
The gang attempts to find adventure on the sea after they purchase their 'new' boat.
Mac finally gets his big break after correctly answering a trivia question on the radio. While Frank, Dennis, and Dee take their bar-banter to the internet with their own podcast.
Rejected from a pool club, Mac and Charlie set out fix an abandoned pool to help cope with the Philly heat wave. Meanwhile, Dennis and Dee go about dealing with the heat in a different way.

Episode.EpisodeName: Mac's Mom Burns Her House Down
Episode.Overview: Mac's mother is left homeless after she burns down her house, which leaves Charlie and Mac with no choice but to make new living arrangements; when Dee feels under the weather, Frank tries to muster his paternal instincts to care for her.
The gang gets a real scare after Dee reveals she's pregnant, forcing the guys to recall their last hazy Halloween party to determine who the father is.

Episode.EpisodeName: The Gang Gets a New Member
Episode.GuestStars: |Jason Sudeikis|Dave Foley|Rene Auberjonois|
Episode.Overview: A blast from the past prompts the guys to expand membership, and Dee to re-consider her future.

Episode.GuestStars: Dave Foley
Episode.Overview: Motivated by the drama teacher who inspired her, Dee takes a job as a substitute teacher, and exposes her students to the culture of Paddy's with a field trip to see the Gang's take on the Lethal Weapon series: Lethal Weapon 5.

Episode.EpisodeName: Charlie Kelly: King of the Rats
Episode.Overview: Keeping the basement rodent-free drives Charlie to the brink. The gang throws Charlie a surprise party.

Episode.EpisodeName: The Gang Gets Stranded in the Woods
Episode.Overview: En route to Atlantic City for a charity event, Mac, Frank and Dee get lost. Meanwhile, Dennis and Charlie hitch a ride to town.
Dee's blessed event is fast approaching but the father's identity remains a mystery---to the gang, at least. So they throw a party and invite all of Dee's former flings.

After years of being mistreated by Frank during the holiday season, Dennis and Dee decide to teach him a lesson. Meanwhile, Mac and Charlie reflect on their childhood Christmases, and realize that they were not as joyous and wonderful as they remembered.

Episode.GuestStars: |Alanna Ubach|John Walcutt|Geoffrey Owens|Cort Hightower|Erin Matthews|James Stellos|
Episode.Overview: With Frank intent on marrying a prostitute, The Gang tries to make the best of it by attempting an image makeover to uncover the heart of gold that exists deep inside Frank’s “pretty woman.”

Episode.EpisodeName: The Gang Goes to the Jersey Shore
Episode.GuestStars: |Mary Elizabeth Ellis|Kristina Apgar|Christopher Backus|Jeremy Radin|
Episode.Overview: Dee and Dennis take the gang to their favorite childhood vacation spot where things aren't quite how they remember. While Dee and Dennis see the seedy side of the Jersey Shore, Mac, Frank and Charlie have the nights of their lives.

Episode.GuestStars: |Artemis Pebdani|Caitlin Carmichael|Erik Jensen|Maxim Knight|Emily Evan Rae|Cory Blevins|Vanessa Celso|Anise Fuller|
Episode.Overview: Frank finds himself in the child beauty-pageant business and fears that people might think that he's in it for the wrong reasons. Meanwhile, Dee wages war on stage moms, and Mac, Dennis and Charlie think they have found a contestant to back.

Episode.GuestStars: Kim Hawthorne
Episode.Overview: Dee faces an IRS audit over her claim that the baby she carried as a surrogate is her dependent, while the guys decide to run the bar in an unemotional, democratic manner rather than their typical method of shouting and personal attacks.

Episode.GuestStars: |Jon Polito|Naturi Naughton|Lance Reddick|Matt Corboy|Pam Trotter|Kim Yarbrough|
Episode.Overview: When Frank's long lost brother Gino shows up at the bar, the two of them tell the gang about the jazz club they ran in the 1960s and 70s, and how they fell out over Shadynasty, a singer who was the love of both of their lives.

Episode.GuestStars: |David Hornsby|Jessica Collins|Elena Diaz|Derek Basco|Marisa Dorchock|Katie Gill|
Episode.Overview: As a hurricane threatens Philadelphia, Mac, Dennis and Charlie go to a mall to buy supplies and check out the large breasted TV reporter broadcasting from there, while Frank and Dee prepare Paddy's, and its basement bunker, for the storm.

Episode.EpisodeName: Chardee MacDennis: The Game of Games
Episode.Overview: The gang plays the most twisted board game ever. Dee and Dennis face Mac, Charlie and Frank.

Episode.GuestStars: |David Marciano|Rosalie Ward|Luenell|John F. Beach|Justin Dray|
Episode.Overview: The gang uses the Internet to cyber-stalk their prey. Frank tries to drum up business for Paddy's with a viral video.

Episode.GuestStars: |Susan Park|Robert Wu|Arnold Chun|Kylie Kim|
Episode.Overview: The Gang's plan to "extract" an "artifact" from a residence is jeopardized when the owners turn out to be home. Having not been noticed on the way in, they must make a plan to get the same result for the way out.

Episode.GuestStars: |William Morgan Sheppard|Michael O'Hearn|Leonora Pitts|
Episode.Overview: Step inside the confession booth with Mac as he tells a befuddled priest why his fatness is the fault of the other members of The Gang.

Episode.GuestStars: |Mariann Gavelo|Damian Achilles|Marcus Choi|Claire Risoli|Tracy Esposito|Maria Russell|Stephen Hill|John Monforto|Lisa Schwartz|Lyman Chen|
Episode.Overview: Traffic problems as a result of the President's visit to Philadelphia makes it difficult for the gang to see the summer's biggest film, "Thunder Gun Express".

Episode.GuestStars: |Mary Elizabeth Ellis|Sasha RoizCatherine Reitman|Cormac Bluestone|Nick Wechsler|Ian Reed Kesler|Frances Turner|Caleb Followill|Nathan Followill|
Episode.Overview: The gang have much to prove when they attend their high-school reunion. They meet old friends and make new foes as they stroll down memory lane.
The gang come up with a new plan to buff their tarnished high-school reputations at their reunion.

Dennis and Dee's ailing grandfather Pop-Pop is wasting away in the hospital, and they have to decide whether or not to pull the plug. Things get complicated when The Gang learns of Pop-Pop's history as a Nazi, and Mac, Charlie and Frank set off in search of the old man's spoils from the war.
With the garbage men of Philadelphia on strike, Frank concocts a plan to undercut the union and get the contract to collect the city's trash.
The gang make a disturbing discovery after crashing Maureen's wedding.

Episode.GuestStars: |Alexandra Daddario|Mary Elizabeth Ellis|
Episode.Overview: Charlie and Dee become romantically involved with two members of a wealthy family, which arouses jealousy in Mac, Dennis, and Frank.

The Gang gets Freudian as they step into the therapist's office to work through their mountain of issues, but when Dennis thinks he has everyone figured out, the shrink turns the tables on him and exposes the insanity in his unique brand of pop psychology.

Episode.GuestStars: |Sean Combs|Lynne Marie Stewart|
Episode.Overview: Mac, Charlie and Dee struggle with their faith as Charlie's mom fights cancer. Meanwhile, Frank loses his memory amidst a search for buried treasure.

With Charlie under his wing, Frank cleans up so he can get his hands dirty and help out his old company with one last big merger. An unwritten rule of the bar gets the rest of the gang caught up in a case of mistaken identity.

Episode.GuestStars: Cheryl Lynn Bowers
Episode.Overview: After slipping into an unhealthy obsession with computer games, The Gang wrestles to define the difference between the real and the virtual worlds.

Every member of The Gang has something to celebrate at Guigino's, Philly's finest eatery, but when Mac and Dennis' private dinner is interrupted by an unexpected sighting of Frank and Charlie, the in-fighting begins. Dee also turns up at a table for one, and over the course of the night, the "one-ups-manship" soars to new heights.

Episode.EpisodeName: Reynolds vs. Reynolds: The Cereal Defense
Episode.Overview: Court is in session at Paddy's Pub as Frank and Dennis present their cases to the rest of the gang, resulting in a verdict that will change their lives FOREVER... but not really.

Episode.GuestStars: |Ken Davitian|Peter Jacobson|Lavell Crawford|Steve Lewis|Karah Donovan|Hal Devi|
Episode.Overview: Dee starts to embrace the desperate, self-loathing qualities the guys have beaten into her over the years, sending her stand-up comedy career to unexpected places.
After Frank appears on Local Television advocating gun ownership, the rest of the gang takes a look at the ownership process and alternatives to find a common ground on this still heated issue.

Episode.EpisodeName: The Gang Tries Desperately to Win an Award
Episode.Overview: Tired of failing to be recognized for their years of service in the bar industry, the gang changes their ways to give the patrons what they think they want.

Episode.EpisodeName: Mac and Dennis Buy a Timeshare
Episode.Overview: The gang does their best to recoup their investments in questionable schemes by dumping their losses on Ben the soldier while trying to avoid being duped again by whatever mastermind is pulling their strings.

Episode.GuestStars: Seann William Scott
Episode.Overview: Everyone in the gang gets a day to do what they want while everyone else in the gang must participate willingly. This is Mac's Day... and its got twice the "Mac".

Episode.GuestStars: Mary Elizabeth Ellis
Episode.Overview: When a routine trip to a convenience store places the gang in the middle of an armed robbery, each of them is forced to explore how they react in extreme situations.

When a severe flu outbreak sweeps through Philadelphia, the gang chooses to voluntarily quarantine themselves inside of Paddy's in an attempt to keep their singing voices pristine for an upcoming singing competition.

Episode.GuestStars: Mary Elizabeth Ellis
Episode.Overview: When an experiment successfully multiplies Charlie's intellect and takes him away from the bar, the rest of the gang find themselves struggling to complete the menial "Charlie Work" that has kept the bar running for so long.

After creative differences over what constitutes tasteful nudity cause Frank to pull his money out of "Lethal Weapon 6" during filming, Mac, Dennis, and Charlie screen their rough footage for investors in hopes of raising enough capital to finish the production of their latest masterpiece.

Episode.GuestStars: |Mary Lynn Rajskub|Jimmi Simpson|Nate Mooney|Zachary Knighton|
Episode.Overview: When some bad blood with old foes compromises their ideal Thanksgiving, the gang decides to make amends by breaking bread with those they've hurt.

Episode.GuestStars: |Wade Boggs|Jennifer Elise Cox|Emily Wilson|Kareem Ferguson|Jerry Hauck|Jamie Landau|
Episode.Overview: Mac oversees the gang while they compete to break Wade Boggs’ legendary beer drinking record.

Episode.GuestStars: |Michael Naughton|Mary Elizabeth Ellis|Jareb Dauplaise|Nick Gehlfuss|Andy Ridings|Jon Baggio|Pete Carboni|Jayme Lynn Evans|Gabriela Fresquez|Kimberly Whalen|Meredith Giangrande|Malea Mitchell|Matthew Jones|Eric Normington|Jenny Phagan|Jen Oda|
Episode.Overview: The gang gets into the online dating scene to expand their matchmaking potential.

Episode.GuestStars: |David Hornsby|Dominic Burgess|Aubrey Morris|Graham Clarke|Jeff Howard|Michael Shaktah|Biff Wiff|
Episode.Overview: When Psycho Pete, long lost member of the Freight Train, is released from the mental hospital, Dennis and Dee rush to get him recommitted while Charlie and Mac attempt to restore him to his former hard-partying form.

Episode.GuestStars: |Francesca P. Roberts|David Pressman|
Episode.Overview: Charlie directs The Gang in balancing a scheme involving live chickens, steaks and airline miles with a health inspection, in a fast hectic manner.

Episode.GuestStars: |Michael Naughton|Jim Lau|Elizabeth Sung|
Episode.Overview: Mac, Dennis and Dee spy on the fish factory. Frank and Charlie become suspicious.

Episode.GuestStars: |Andrew Leeds|Allison Munn|D'Anthony Palms|Brady Smith|Maria Zyrianova|Kasey Dailey|David Douglas|Travis Guba|
Episode.Overview: After another failed venture, the Gang wonders if their group dynamic is bringing them down as individuals, causing them to separate from one another and find out who they really are.

Episode.GuestStars: |Lance Barber|Gregory Scott Cummins|Sandy Martin|Catherine Reitman|Lynne Marie Stewart|Cheryl Texiera|Jason Manuel Olazabal|Jessica Brown|Dakota Buchanan|Bob Wiltfong|
Episode.Overview: News surfaces about Mac's Dad, Luther, being a murder suspect. Mac goes into full "P.I." mode to clear his father of any wrong doing.

Episode.EpisodeName: The Gang Goes on Family Fight
Episode.GuestStars: |Keegan-Michael Key|David Hornsby|Anna Maria Horsford|Theo Breaux|William C. Mitchell|Jammie Patton|Joe Thornton Jr.|Megan Messmer|
Episode.Overview: When the gang appears on a nationally broadcasted game show, Dennis does his best to keep the gang’s weirdness under wraps.

Episode.GuestStars: |Alden Ray|J.D. Walsh|
Episode.Overview: After Frank decides he's worked long enough, the rest of the gang strategizes amongst and against each other for control over "Paddy's."

Episode.EpisodeName: Ass Kickers United: Mac and Charlie Join a Cult
Episode.GuestStars: |Dax Shepard|Sandy Martin|Lynne Marie Stewart|T.J. Hoban|Brittney Alger|Cazzey Louis Cereghino|
Episode.Overview: "Asskickers" isn't just a hot new way to work out; it's a way of life...and maybe a cult.
The foursome demonstrate Chardee MacDennis for an interested board game executive, but the game sends things into chaos despite the gang's truce.
After falling out of the window, Frank thinks that it's 2006. The other three see this as a chance to fix their past mistakes.
Dennis and Frank battle Dee and Mac for control of the mountain, and Charlie learns the rules of the slopes.
Dennis makes a movie spotlighting his erotic memoirs while Frank and Mac try to pass off Charlie as a gifted artist to make money.

Episode.EpisodeName: Mac & Dennis Move to the Suburbs
Episode.Overview: Mac and Dennis move to the suburbs for cheaper rent but find it hard to adjust.
The gang have a new scheme and Frank tries to keep up.

Episode.EpisodeName: McPoyle vs. Ponderosa: The Trial of the Century
Episode.Overview: Old grievances surface when the Lawyers sues Bill Ponderosa on behalf of Liam McPoyle and his lost eye.

Episode.GuestStars: |Mercer Boffey|Christiann Castellanos|Santana Dempsey|Austin Lyon|
Episode.Overview: Dennis tries to create an innovative mobile Paddy's pub experience but runs into trouble when customers refuse to cooperate, while Charlie and Mac attempt to catch a thieving leprechaun.

Episode.GuestStars: |Sloane Avery|Marc Fajardo|
Episode.Overview: The gang tries to take a vacation from their usual dynamic by going on a cruise, but old habits die hard.

Episode.EpisodeName: The Gang Goes to Hell: Part Two
Episode.Overview: The gang gets real with one another in the face of death.
